div.p: DIV1 (i.e. level-1 text division) is an element that marks the second largest structural division in a document of any kind within the textbase. In EVENTS documents (used in early stages in the work), DIV1 was contained inside a DIV0 and contained one or more CHRONEVENTs, each with BIBCIT. In BIOGRAPHY sections of entries, DIV1 follows heading and standard (name) elements inside a DIV0. It often contains a HEADING, then one of a number of anchored content tags, such as Birth, DEATH, or EDUCATION. In WRITING sections, a DIV1 occurs following a DIV0 and contains an optional heading followed by one or more DIV2s.

div.codeblock: <DIV0><HEADING>Biography</HEADING><STANDARD>Abdy, Maria</STANDARD><DIV1>All subsequent document sub-divisions occur here. . . </DIV1></DIV0>
